<a id="TileSet"></a>

# TileSet

**Inherits:** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Tile library for tilemaps.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A TileSet is a library of tiles for a [TileMapLayer](TileMapLayer.md). A TileSet handles a list of [TileSetSource](TileSetSource.md), each of them storing a set of tiles.

Tiles can either be from a [TileSetAtlasSource](TileSetAtlasSource.md), which renders tiles out of a texture with support for physics, navigation, etc., or from a [TileSetScenesCollectionSource](TileSetScenesCollectionSource.md), which exposes scene-based tiles.

Tiles are referenced by using three IDs: their source ID, their atlas coordinates ID, and their alternative tile ID.

A TileSet can be configured so that its tiles expose more or fewer properties. To do so, the TileSet resources use property layers, which you can add or remove depending on your needs.

For example, adding a physics layer allows giving collision shapes to your tiles. Each layer has dedicated properties (physics layer and mask), so you may add several TileSet physics layers for each type of collision you need.

See the functions to add new layers for more information.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_TileSet_TileShape"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **TileShape**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_TileSet_TileShape)

<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_SHAPE_SQUARE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileShape](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileShape) **TILE_SHAPE_SQUARE** = `0`

Rectangular tile shape.<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_SHAPE_ISOMETRIC"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileShape](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileShape) **TILE_SHAPE_ISOMETRIC** = `1`

Diamond tile shape (for isometric look).

\ **Note:** Isometric **TileSet** works best if all sibling [TileMapLayer](TileMapLayer.md)\\ s and their parent inheriting from [Node2D](Node2D.md) have Y-sort enabled.<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_SHAPE_HALF_OFFSET_SQUARE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileShape](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileShape) **TILE_SHAPE_HALF_OFFSET_SQUARE** = `2`

Rectangular tile shape with one row/column out of two offset by half a tile.<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_SHAPE_HEXAGON"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileShape](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileShape) **TILE_SHAPE_HEXAGON** = `3`

Hexagonal tile shape.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TileSet_TileLayout"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **TileLayout**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_TileSet_TileLayout)

<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_LAYOUT_STACKED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout) **TILE_LAYOUT_STACKED** = `0`

Tile coordinates layout where both axis stay consistent with their respective local horizontal and vertical axis.<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_LAYOUT_STACKED_OFFSET"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout) **TILE_LAYOUT_STACKED_OFFSET** = `1`

Same as [TILE_LAYOUT_STACKED](TileSet.md#TileSet_constant_TILE_LAYOUT_STACKED), but the first half-offset is negative instead of positive.<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_LAYOUT_STAIRS_RIGHT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout) **TILE_LAYOUT_STAIRS_RIGHT** = `2`

Tile coordinates layout where the horizontal axis stay horizontal, and the vertical one goes down-right.<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_LAYOUT_STAIRS_DOWN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout) **TILE_LAYOUT_STAIRS_DOWN** = `3`

Tile coordinates layout where the vertical axis stay vertical, and the horizontal one goes down-right.<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_LAYOUT_DIAMOND_RIGHT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout) **TILE_LAYOUT_DIAMOND_RIGHT** = `4`

Tile coordinates layout where the horizontal axis goes up-right, and the vertical one goes down-right.<a id="TileSet_constant_TILE_LAYOUT_DIAMOND_DOWN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout) **TILE_LAYOUT_DIAMOND_DOWN** = `5`

Tile coordinates layout where the horizontal axis goes down-right, and the vertical one goes down-left.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="TileSet_property_tile_layout"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout) **tile_layout** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_property_tile_layout)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_tile_layout**\ (\ value\: [TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout)\ )
- [TileLayout](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileLayout) **get_tile_layout**\ (\ )

For all half-offset shapes (Isometric, Hexagonal and Half-Offset square), changes the way tiles are indexed in the [TileMapLayer](TileMapLayer.md) grid.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_property_tile_offset_axis"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[TileOffsetAxis](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileOffsetAxis) **tile_offset_axis** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_property_tile_offset_axis)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_tile_offset_axis**\ (\ value\: [TileOffsetAxis](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileOffsetAxis)\ )
- [TileOffsetAxis](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileOffsetAxis) **get_tile_offset_axis**\ (\ )

For all half-offset shapes (Isometric, Hexagonal and Half-Offset square), determines the offset axis.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_property_tile_shape"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[TileShape](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileShape) **tile_shape** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_property_tile_shape)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_tile_shape**\ (\ value\: [TileShape](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileShape)\ )
- [TileShape](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TileShape) **get_tile_shape**\ (\ )

The tile shape.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_property_tile_size"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **tile_size** = `Vector2i(16, 16)` [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_property_tile_size)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_tile_size**\ (\ value\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ )
- [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_tile_size**\ (\ )

The tile size, in pixels. For all tile shapes, this size corresponds to the encompassing rectangle of the tile shape. This is thus the minimal cell size required in an atlas.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_property_uv_clipping"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **uv_clipping** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_property_uv_clipping)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_uv_clipping**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_uv_clipping**\ (\ )

Enables/Disable uv clipping when rendering the tiles.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="TileSet_method_add_custom_data_layer"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_custom_data_layer**\ (\ to_position\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_add_custom_data_layer)

Adds a custom data layer to the TileSet at the given position `to_position` in the array. If `to_position` is -1, adds it at the end of the array.

Custom data layers allow assigning custom properties to atlas tiles.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_add_navigation_layer"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_navigation_layer**\ (\ to_position\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_add_navigation_layer)

Adds a navigation layer to the TileSet at the given position `to_position` in the array. If `to_position` is -1, adds it at the end of the array.

Navigation layers allow assigning a navigable area to atlas tiles.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_add_occlusion_layer"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_occlusion_layer**\ (\ to_position\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_add_occlusion_layer)

Adds an occlusion layer to the TileSet at the given position `to_position` in the array. If `to_position` is -1, adds it at the end of the array.

Occlusion layers allow assigning occlusion polygons to atlas tiles.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_add_pattern"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **add_pattern**\ (\ pattern\: [TileMapPattern](TileMapPattern.md), index\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_add_pattern)

Adds a [TileMapPattern](TileMapPattern.md) to be stored in the TileSet resource. If provided, insert it at the given `index`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_add_physics_layer"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_physics_layer**\ (\ to_position\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_add_physics_layer)

Adds a physics layer to the TileSet at the given position `to_position` in the array. If `to_position` is -1, adds it at the end of the array.

Physics layers allow assigning collision polygons to atlas tiles.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_add_source"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **add_source**\ (\ source\: [TileSetSource](TileSetSource.md), atlas_source_id_override\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_add_source)

Adds a [TileSetSource](TileSetSource.md) to the TileSet. If `atlas_source_id_override` is not -1, also set its source ID. Otherwise, a unique identifier is automatically generated.

The function returns the added source ID or -1 if the source could not be added.

\ **Warning:** A source cannot belong to two TileSets at the same time. If the added source was attached to another **TileSet**, it will be removed from that one.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_add_terrain"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_terrain**\ (\ terrain_set\: [int](int.md), to_position\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_add_terrain)

Adds a new terrain to the given terrain set `terrain_set` at the given position `to_position` in the array. If `to_position` is -1, adds it at the end of the array.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_add_terrain_set"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_terrain_set**\ (\ to_position\: [int](int.md) = -1\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_add_terrain_set)

Adds a new terrain set at the given position `to_position` in the array. If `to_position` is -1, adds it at the end of the array.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_cleanup_invalid_tile_proxies"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **cleanup_invalid_tile_proxies**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_cleanup_invalid_tile_proxies)

Clears tile proxies pointing to invalid tiles.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_clear_tile_proxies"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_tile_proxies**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_clear_tile_proxies)

Clears all tile proxies.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_get_alternative_level_tile_proxy"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md) **get_alternative_level_tile_proxy**\ (\ source_from\: [int](int.md), coords_from\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_from\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_get_alternative_level_tile_proxy)

Returns the alternative-level proxy for the given identifiers. The returned array contains the three proxie's target identifiers (source ID, atlas coords ID and alternative tile ID).

If the TileSet has no proxy for the given identifiers, returns an empty Array.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_get_coords_level_tile_proxy"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md) **get_coords_level_tile_proxy**\ (\ source_from\: [int](int.md), coords_from\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_get_coords_level_tile_proxy)

Returns the coordinate-level proxy for the given identifiers. The returned array contains the two target identifiers of the proxy (source ID and atlas coordinates ID).

If the TileSet has no proxy for the given identifiers, returns an empty Array.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_get_custom_data_layer_by_name"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Returns the index of the custom data layer identified by the given name.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

Returns the name of the custom data layer identified by the given index.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-method -->

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_map_tile_proxy"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md) **map_tile_proxy**\ (\ source_from\: [int](int.md), coords_from\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_from\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_map_tile_proxy)

According to the configured proxies, maps the provided identifiers to a new set of identifiers. The source ID, atlas coordinates ID and alternative tile ID are returned as a 3 elements Array.

This function first look for matching alternative-level proxies, then coordinates-level proxies, then source-level proxies.

If no proxy corresponding to provided identifiers are found, returns the same values the ones used as arguments.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_set_alternative_level_tile_proxy"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_alternative_level_tile_proxy**\ (\ source_from\: [int](int.md), coords_from\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_from\: [int](int.md), source_to\: [int](int.md), coords_to\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), alternative_to\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_set_alternative_level_tile_proxy)

Create an alternative-level proxy for the given identifiers. A proxy will map set of tile identifiers to another set of identifiers.

Proxied tiles can be automatically replaced in TileMapLayer nodes using the editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_set_coords_level_tile_proxy"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_coords_level_tile_proxy**\ (\ p_source_from\: [int](int.md), coords_from\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), source_to\: [int](int.md), coords_to\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_set_coords_level_tile_proxy)

Creates a coordinates-level proxy for the given identifiers. A proxy will map set of tile identifiers to another set of identifiers. The alternative tile ID is kept the same when using coordinates-level proxies.

Proxied tiles can be automatically replaced in TileMapLayer nodes using the editor.

Sets the name of the custom data layer identified by the given index. Names are identifiers of the layer therefore if the name is already taken it will fail and raise an error.

<a id="TileSet_method_set_navigation_layer_layer_value"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Based on `value`, enables or disables the specified navigation layer of the TileSet navigation data layer identified by the given `layer_index`, given a navigation_layers `layer_number` between 1 and 32.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_set_source_id"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_source_id**\ (\ source_id\: [int](int.md), new_source_id\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_set_source_id)

Changes a source's ID.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_set_source_level_tile_proxy"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_source_level_tile_proxy**\ (\ source_from\: [int](int.md), source_to\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_set_source_level_tile_proxy)

Creates a source-level proxy for the given source ID. A proxy will map set of tile identifiers to another set of identifiers. Both the atlas coordinates ID and the alternative tile ID are kept the same when using source-level proxies.

Proxied tiles can be automatically replaced in TileMapLayer nodes using the editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_set_terrain_color"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_terrain_color**\ (\ terrain_set\: [int](int.md), terrain_index\: [int](int.md), color\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_set_terrain_color)

Sets a terrain's color. This color is used for identifying the different terrains in the TileSet editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_set_terrain_name"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_terrain_name**\ (\ terrain_set\: [int](int.md), terrain_index\: [int](int.md), name\: [String](String.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_set_terrain_name)

Sets a terrain's name.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TileSet_method_set_terrain_set_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_terrain_set_mode**\ (\ terrain_set\: [int](int.md), mode\: [TerrainMode](TileSet.md#enum_TileSet_TerrainMode)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#TileSet_method_set_terrain_set_mode)

Sets a terrain mode. Each mode determines which bits of a tile shape is used to match the neighboring tiles' terrains.
